snippet: The money will go toward public works projects, small businesses and subsidies for companies that invest in new technology.
abstract: Japanese government approves emergency stimulus spending of more than $100 billion, part of aggressive push by Prime Min Shinzo Abe to kick-start growth in country’s long-moribund economy.
lead_paragraph: The money will go toward public works projects, small businesses and subsidies for companies that invest in new technology.

headline.seo: Japan Approves $116 Billion in Emergency Economic Stimulus
headline.main: Japan Approves $116 Billion for Urgent Economic Stimulus
headline.print_headline: Japan Approves $116 Billion For Urgent Economic Stimulus
